post.description: Checks the availability of a Traffic Manager Relative DNS name.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

requestBody.description: The Traffic Manager name parameters supplied to the CheckTrafficManagerNameAvailability operation.

default.description: Default response. It will be deserialized as per the Error definition.

get.description: Get the subscription-level key used for Real User Metrics collection.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: The subscription-level Traffic Manager Real User Metrics key.

default.description: Default response. It will be deserialized as per the Error definition.

put.description: Create or update a subscription-level key used for Real User Metrics collection.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

201.description: A new subscription-level key has been created for Real User Metrics collection.

default.description: Default response. It will be deserialized as per the Error definition.

delete.description: Delete a subscription-level key used for Real User Metrics collection.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client Api Version.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: The Traffic Manager Real User Metrics key was deleted successfully.

default.description: Default response. It will be deserialized as per the Error definition.

CheckTrafficManagerRelativeDnsNameAvaila.description: Parameters supplied to check Traffic Manager name operation.

CloudError.description: An error returned by the Azure Resource Manager

CloudErrorBody.description: The content of an error returned by the Azure Resource Manager

boolean.description: The result of the operation or request.

DeleteOperationResult.description: The result of the request or operation.

fqdn.description: The fully-qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Traffic Manager profile. This is formed from the concatenation of the RelativeName with the DNS domain used by Azure Traffic Manager.

relativeName.description: The relative DNS name provided by this Traffic Manager profile. This value is combined with the DNS domain name used by Azure Traffic Manager to form the fully-qualified domain name (FQDN) of the profile.

ttl.description: The DNS Time-To-Live (TTL), in seconds. This informs the local DNS resolvers and DNS clients how long to cache DNS responses provided by this Traffic Manager profile.

DnsConfig.description: Class containing DNS settings in a Traffic Manager profile.

Endpoint.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager endpoint.

endpointLocation.description: Specifies the location of the external or nested endpoints when using the 'Performance' traffic routing method.

endpointMonitorStatus.description: The monitoring status of the endpoint.

endpointStatus.description: The status of the endpoint. If the endpoint is Enabled, it is probed for endpoint health and is included in the traffic routing method.

geoMapping.description: The list of countries/regions mapped to this endpoint when using the 'Geographic' traffic routing method. Please consult Traffic Manager Geographic documentation for a full list of accepted values.

minChildEndpoints.description: The minimum number of endpoints that must be available in the child profile in order for the parent profile to be considered available. Only applicable to endpoint of type 'NestedEndpoints'.

priority.description: The priority of this endpoint when using the 'Priority' traffic routing method. Possible values are from 1 to 1000, lower values represent higher priority. This is an optional parameter.  If specified, it must be specified on all endpoints, and no two endpoints can share the same priority value.

subnets.description: The list of subnets, IP addresses, and/or address ranges mapped to this endpoint when using the 'Subnet' traffic routing method. An empty list will match all ranges not covered by other endpoints.

scope.description: Block size (number of leading bits in the subnet mask).

items.description: Subnet first address, scope, and/or last address.

target.description: The fully-qualified DNS name or IP address of the endpoint. Traffic Manager returns this value in DNS responses to direct traffic to this endpoint.

targetResourceId.description: The Azure Resource URI of the of the endpoint. Not applicable to endpoints of type 'ExternalEndpoints'.

weight.description: The weight of this endpoint when using the 'Weighted' traffic routing method. Possible values are from 1 to 1000.

EndpointProperties.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager endpoint properties.

GeographicHierarchyProperties.description: Class representing the properties of the Geographic hierarchy used with the Geographic traffic routing method.

endpointId.description: A number uniquely identifying this endpoint in query experiences.

resourceId.description: The ARM Resource ID of this Traffic Manager endpoint.

HeatMapEndpoint.description: Class which is a sparse representation of a Traffic Manager endpoint.

HeatMapModel.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager HeatMap.

endTime.description: The ending of the time window for this HeatMap, exclusive.

endpoints.description: The endpoints used in this HeatMap calculation.

startTime.description: The beginning of the time window for this HeatMap, inclusive.

trafficFlows.description: The traffic flows produced in this HeatMap calculation.

HeatMapProperties.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager HeatMap properties.

expectedStatusCodeRanges.description: List of expected status code ranges.

items.description: Min and max value of a status code range.

intervalInSeconds.description: The monitor interval for endpoints in this profile. This is the interval at which Traffic Manager will check the health of each endpoint in this profile.

path.description: The path relative to the endpoint domain name used to probe for endpoint health.

port.description: The TCP port used to probe for endpoint health.

profileMonitorStatus.description: The profile-level monitoring status of the Traffic Manager profile.

protocol.description: The protocol (HTTP, HTTPS or TCP) used to probe for endpoint health.

timeoutInSeconds.description: The monitor timeout for endpoints in this profile. This is the time that Traffic Manager allows endpoints in this profile to response to the health check.

toleratedNumberOfFailures.description: The number of consecutive failed health check that Traffic Manager tolerates before declaring an endpoint in this profile Degraded after the next failed health check.

MonitorConfig.description: Class containing endpoint monitoring settings in a Traffic Manager profile.

Profile.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager profile.

value.description: Gets the list of Traffic manager profiles.

ProfileListResult.description: The list Traffic Manager profiles operation response.

endpoints.description: The list of endpoints in the Traffic Manager profile.

maxReturn.description: Maximum number of endpoints to be returned for MultiValue routing type.

profileStatus.description: The status of the Traffic Manager profile.

trafficRoutingMethod.description: The traffic routing method of the Traffic Manager profile.

trafficViewEnrollmentStatus.description: Indicates whether Traffic View is 'Enabled' or 'Disabled' for the Traffic Manager profile. Null, indicates 'Disabled'. Enabling this feature will increase the cost of the Traffic Manage profile.

ProfileProperties.description: Class representing the Traffic Manager profile properties.

ProxyResource.description: The resource model definition for a ARM proxy resource. It will have everything other than required location and tags

endpointId.description: The id of the endpoint from the 'endpoints' array which these queries were routed to.

latency.description: The latency experienced by queries originating from this location.

queryCount.description: The number of queries originating from this location.

QueryExperience.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager HeatMap query experience properties.

regions.description: The list of Regions grouped under this Region in the Geographic Hierarchy.

Region.description: Class representing a region in the Geographic hierarchy used with the Geographic traffic routing method.

id.description: Fully qualified resource Id for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/trafficManagerProfiles/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. Ex- Microsoft.Network/trafficManagerProfiles.

Resource.description: The core properties of ARM resources

location.description: The Azure Region where the resource lives

TrackedResource.description: The resource model definition for a ARM tracked top level resource

latitude.description: The approximate latitude that these queries originated from.

longitude.description: The approximate longitude that these queries originated from.

queryExperiences.description: The query experiences produced in this HeatMap calculation.

sourceIp.description: The IP address that this query experience originated from.

TrafficFlow.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager HeatMap traffic flow properties.

TrafficManagerGeographicHierarchy.description: Class representing the Geographic hierarchy used with the Geographic traffic routing method.

message.description: Descriptive message that explains why the name is not available, when applicable.

nameAvailable.description: Describes whether the relative name is available or not.

reason.description: The reason why the name is not available, when applicable.

TrafficManagerNameAvailability.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager Name Availability response.

UserMetricsModel.description: Class representing Traffic Manager User Metrics.

key.description: The key returned by the User Metrics operation.

UserMetricsProperties.description: Class representing a Traffic Manager Real User Metrics key response.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.
